Package com.mhealthatlas.taxonomy.config.kafka

Class KafkaConsumerConfig

java.lang.Object
com.mhealthatlas.taxonomy.config.kafka.KafkaConsumerConfig
@EnableKafka
@Configuration
public class KafkaConsumerConfig
extends java.lang.Object
Configures the KafkaListenerContainerFactory used by the KafkaListener's.

  • Field Summary

    Fields 
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    private java.util.List<java.lang.String> supportedEventTypes

  • Field Details

    • supportedEventTypes

      private java.util.List<java.lang.String> supportedEventTypes
      List of all event names processed by the service:
      • android_application_deleted
      • android_application_version_added
      • android_application_version_changed
      • android_application_added
      • android_application_changed
      • ios_application_deleted
      • ios_application_version_added

  • Constructor Details

    • KafkaConsumerConfig

      public KafkaConsumerConfig()

  • Method Details

    • consumerFactory

      public org.springframework.kafka.core.ConsumerFactory<java.lang.String,​byte[]> consumerFactory()
      Configures a Kafka ConsumerFactory to use a StringDeserializer for desrealisation of the event key and a ByteArrayDeserializer for the event payload.

      The ByteArrayDeserializer is used to not allocate objects for event types not listed in supportedEventTypes since the event desrealisation is executed before the events are filtered.

      Also the Kafka server and the consumer group id is set.

      Returns:
      the configured ConsumerFactory

    • kafkaListenerContainerFactory

      @Bean public org.springframework.kafka.config.ConcurrentKafkaListenerContainerFactory<java.lang.String,​byte[]> kafkaListenerContainerFactory()
      Configures a Kafka ConcurrentKafkaListenerContainerFactory as the used KafkaListenerContainerFactory. The consumerFactory() is set as the ConsumerFactory. Additionally a custom filter strategy is implemented. The filter strategy is used to ensure the only events with an event type listed in supportedEventTypes are forwarded to the KafkaListener's.
      Returns:
      the configured ConcurrentKafkaListenerContainerFactory
